column1: Bavette's Bar & Boeuf////Entering Bavette's is an experience
column2: it immediately reminds me of a lot of old stately restaurants in Washington DC
column3: or an English gentlemen's club (I should clarify that there are no strippers in gentlemen's clubs in England. They are for the upper classes.  But that said
column4: why do Americans call strip clubs "gentlemen's clubs" anyway?  I mean
column5: if you're going in these places
column7: ogling women and salivating over reproductive organs. And frankly
column8: I don't think the "dancers" really want you to act like a gentleman!  In fact
